column1: We used real -time input  to focus on four critical nodes of the global financial system : financing of the real economy
During normal times, companies and retail investors treat shares in money market funds like cash—as fully fungible, riskless, and payable on -demand.

S ome evidence suggests that banks may have been hesitant to use their regulatory capital buffers to meet credit demand  (despite the stated intent from superviso rs that banks should use their buffers under stress ).
